name: Tangela
flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Tangrowth
flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon was healed during this turn, this attack does 130 more damage.

name: Scyther
flavorText: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 50 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Pinsir
flavorText: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Chikorita
flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Chikorita
flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Bayleef
flavorText: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Meganium
flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. Choose 1 of your Basic Pokemon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokemon, put that card onto the Basic Pokemon to evolve it. You can use this Ability during your first turn or on a Pokemon that was put into play this turn.

name: Spinarak
flavorText: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Put this Pokemon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone.

name: Ariados
flavorText: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.
Attack1Text: Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand during their next turn, prevent all effects of that card done to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Hoppip
flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for Hoppip and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Hoppip
flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

name: Skiploom
flavorText: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Jumpluff, put this Pokemon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone, and put that Jumpluff in its place. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Jumpluff
flavorText: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokemon, except ◇ (Prism Star) Pokemon, in the Lost Zone.

name: Pineco
flavorText: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokemon that peck it by mistake.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Shuckle
flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and discard them. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Shuckle-GX
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks from your opponent's Pokemon that have 2 or fewer Energy attached to them.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Heracross
flavorText: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
Attack2Text: If you have any Stage 2 Pokemon on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Celebi ◇
flavorText: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.
Attack1Text: Devolve any number of your Benched Pokemon as many times as you like. Put each Evolution card removed this way into your hand.
Attack2Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Treecko
flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokemon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Grovyle
flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokemon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Sceptile-GX
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Move a Grass Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Wurmple
flavorText: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

name: Wurmple
flavorText: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Silcoon
flavorText: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 4 in any combination of Silcoon and Cascoon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Beautifly
flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Cascoon
flavorText: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 4 in any combination of Silcoon and Cascoon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Dustox
flavorText: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokemon Paralyzed and Poisoned. If you do, put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.

name: Nincada
flavorText: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Ninjask
flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may put a Shedinja from your discard pile onto your Bench.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

name: Combee
flavorText: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Combee and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Vespiquen
flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.
Attack1Text: If you have 4 or fewer Grass Pokemon on your Bench, this attack does nothing.

name: Shaymin
flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from your Active Grass Pokemon.

name: Virizion-GX
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Skiddo
flavorText: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Gogoat
flavorText: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Leaf Wallop attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Tapu Bulu
flavorText: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokemon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokemon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Moltres
flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokemon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.
Attack1Text: You may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Cyndaquil
flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

name: Cyndaquil
flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

name: Quilava
flavorText: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Typhlosion
flavorText: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. All Energy attached to your Pokemon are Fire Energy instead of their usual type until the end of your turn. (This includes cards that come into play on this turn.)
Attack1Text: Put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon in the Lost Zone.

name: Slugma
flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Magcargo-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard the top card of your deck. If it's a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Discard any amount of basic Energy from this Pokemon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Houndour
flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.
Attack1Text: Draw a card for each of your Houndour in play.

name: Houndoom
flavorText: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Entei
flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Each player discards the top card of their deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

name: Heatran
flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

name: Victini
flavorText: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Basic Pokemon in play.

name: Litleo
flavorText: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokemon are quick to fight.
Ability1Text: If your opponent has any Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX in play, this Pokemon has no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: This Pokemon does 10 damage to itself.

name: Pyroar
flavorText: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Blacephalon-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned and Confused.
Attack2Text: Put any amount of Fire Energy attached to your Pokemon in the Lost Zone. This attack does 50 damage for each card put in the Lost Zone in this way.

name: Alolan Vulpix
flavorText: In hot weather, this Pokemon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
Ability1Text: If you have any Fairy Pokemon in play, this Pokemon has no Retreat Cost.

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Slowking
flavorText: This Pokemon is so famed for its intellect that a proverb still persists in some regions: "When in doubt, ask Slowking."
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand and put a card you find there in the Lost Zone.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Lapras
flavorText: These Pokemon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Delibird
flavorText: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokemon, so it's always scrounging around for more food.
Attack1Text: Choose any number of your Benched Pokemon that don't already have a Pokemon Tool attached to them. For each of those Pokemon, search your deck for a Pokemon Tool card and attach it to that Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Mantine
flavorText: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

name: Suicune
flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Suicune-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is on your Bench, you may shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Cubchoo
flavorText: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Beartic
flavorText: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a Pokemon-GX or a Pokemon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't attack during your next turn.

name: White Kyurem
flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, discard it.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has any Fire Energy attached to it, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Popplio
flavorText: This Pokemon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Popplio
flavorText: This Pokemon can control water bubbles. It practice diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Brionne
flavorText: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon.

name: Primarina
flavorText: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokemon's Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon, except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card, attach up to 2 Energy cards to that Pokemon instead of 1.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Mareanie
flavorText: It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

name: Toxapex
flavorText: Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on that Pokemon.

name: Bruxish
flavorText: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Electivire
flavorText: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Lanturn
flavorText: This Pokemon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
Attack1Text: Shuffle 4 Item cards from your discard pile into your deck.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Mareep
flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokemon Asleep.

name: Mareep
flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Flaaffy
flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Ampharos
flavorText: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 Lightning Energy cards from your hand in the Lost Zone. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Raikou
flavorText: This rough Pokemon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.
Attack1Text: If you have any Lightning Energy cards in the Lost Zone, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Pachirisu
flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokemon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokemon. If you discarded a Pokemon Tool card in this way, this attack does 40 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Blitzle
flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

name: Zebstrika
flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard your hand and draw 4 cards.

name: Stunfisk
flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard a Lightning Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Dedenne
flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage for each of your Pokemon in play that has the Nuzzle attack to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Tapu Koko
flavorText: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
Attack1Text: You may switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Flashing Bolt during your next turn.

name: Zeraora-GX
Ability1Text: Each of your Pokemon that has any Lightning Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: This Pokemon can't attack during your next turn.
Attack2Text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Natu
flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokemon, except ◇ (Prism Star) Pokemon, in the Lost Zone.

name: Xatu
flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If you find any Energy cards there, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Espeon
flavorText: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Unown
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, and if there are 66 or more damage counters on your Benched Pokemon, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.

name: Unown
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, and if you have 35 or more cards in your hand, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.

name: Unown
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, and if your opponent has 12 or more Supporter cards in the Lost Zone, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.

name: Wobbuffet
flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it live quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is on your Bench, ◇ (Prism Star) Pokemon in play (both yours and your opponent's) can't attack and have no Abilities.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Girafarig
flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
Attack1Text: Put 2 cards from your opponent's discard pile in the Lost Zone.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Shedinja
flavorText: A most peculiar Pokemon that somehow appears in a Poke Ball when a Nincada evolves.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard all cards attached to this Pokemon and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon as a Pokemon Tool card. When the Pokemon this card is attached to is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 1 fewer Prize card.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Sableye
flavorText: This Pokemon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it's believed that Sableye will steal people's spirits away.
Attack1Text: If you go first, you can use this attack on your first turn. Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Giratina
flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. If you do, put 1 damage counter on 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Sigilyph-GX
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX (even if this Pokemon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon equal to the damage done to this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: This attack does 60 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Yamask
flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Cofagrigus
flavorText: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
Attack1Text: Discard any number of your Benched Pokemon. This attack does 30 more damage for each Benched Pokemon you discarded in this way.

name: Litwick
flavorText: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokemon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Lampent
flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Chandelure
flavorText: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
Attack1Text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on all of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Meloetta
flavorText: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feels of those who hear it.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokemon in play that has the Sing attack. This attack does 10 damage for each heads to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Mareanie
flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Nihilego
flavorText: One of the Ultra Beasts, it's unclear whether or not this Pokemon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if your opponent has exactly 2 Prize cards remaining. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon's attacks and use it as this attack.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused and Poisoned.

name: Poipole
flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
Attack1Text: Look at your face-down Prize cards.

name: Naganadel
flavorText: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Onix
flavorText: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokemon, the more collectors value it. It's a particular favorite among elderly people.
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn while it was your Active Pokemon, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Phanpy
flavorText: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Donphan
flavorText: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, this Pokemon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Rolling Spin attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Hitmontop
flavorText: If you are enchanted by its smooth, dance-like kicks, you may get a closer experience with one than you'd like.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Larvitar
flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon already has 3 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Pupitar
flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by your opponent's attacks until the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Carbink
flavorText: Although this Pokemon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Supporter card and a Stadium card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Alolan Meowth
flavorText: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.
Attack1Text: If you go second, this attack does 60 more damage during your first turn.

name: Alolan Persian
flavorText: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 less damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Umbreon
flavorText: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokemon goes for its threat, and then eats it.
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Tyranitar-GX
Ability1Text: If your opponent's Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from this Pokemon's attacks, put that Pokemon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of the discard pile.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Alolan Diglett
flavorText: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Alolan Dugtrio
flavorText: These Pokemon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Forretress
flavorText: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters piece of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Put this Pokemon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone.

name: Steelix
flavorText: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 50 damage to itself.

name: Scizor
flavorText: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokemon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.
Ability1Text: This Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Dialga
flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an evolved Pokemon, devolve it by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Durant
flavorText: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
Attack1Text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

name: Cobalion
flavorText: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokemon.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

name: Genesect-GX
Ability1Text: This Pokemon may have up to 2 Pokemon Tool cards attached to it. If it loses this Ability, discard Pokemon Tool cards from it until only 1 remains.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Magearna
flavorText: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Item cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: Jigglypuff posses a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual's singing skill depends on its own effort.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Wigglytuff
flavorText: As it inhales, it expands…and expands…and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool card that has "Fairy Charm" in its name attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Marill
flavorText: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.

name: Azumarill
flavorText: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Energy cards you find there to your Pokemon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Snubbull
flavorText: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokemon tends to sleep half the day.
Attack1Text: Discard up to 2 Trainer cards from your hand. This attack does 20 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Granbull
flavorText: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokemon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.
Attack1Text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack does 130 more damage.

name: Ralts
flavorText: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokemon. It hides if it senses hostility.
Attack1Text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Kirlia
flavorText: It has a psychic power that enabled it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Gardevoir
flavorText: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Dedenne
flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Carbink
flavorText: Although this Pokemon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon by any Pokemon that has an Ability.

name: Xerneas ◇
flavorText: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when this Pokemon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokemon, you may move any number of Energy from your other Pokemon to it.
Attack1Text: This Pokemon can't use Bright Horns during your next turn.

name: Cutiefly
flavorText: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Ribombee
flavorText: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is on your Bench, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Fairy Pokemon in play.

name: Morelull
flavorText: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Shiinotic
flavorText: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokemon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokemon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Asleep, your opponent shuffles all Energy from it into their deck.

name: Mimikyu-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Tapu Lele
flavorText: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach a Pokemon Tool card that has "Fairy Charm" in its name from your hand to this Pokemon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokemon Confused.

name: Tapu Fini
flavorText: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokemon and all cards attached to it into their deck.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Chansey
flavorText: Not only are these Pokemon fast runners, they're also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon already has any damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

name: Blissey
flavorText: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokemon.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokemon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

name: Ditto ◇
flavorText: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put any Stage 1 card from your hand onto this Pokemon to evolve it. You can't use this Ability during your first turn or the turn this Pokemon was put into play.

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokemon.

name: Stantler
flavorText: The curved antlers change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Smeargle
flavorText: It draws symbols all over the place to mark its territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls are covered in graffiti.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may use the effect of a Supporter card you find there as the effect of this attack.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Miltank
flavorText: Most people raise it for its milk, but it's quite tough and strong, so it's also well suited for battle.
Attack1Text: Reveal any number of Moomoo Milk cards in your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you revealed in this way.

name: Lugia-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Pelagic Blade during your next turn.

name: Ho-Oh
flavorText: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each type of basic Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Kecleon
flavorText: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon has Unit Energy GrassFireWater attached to it, it is a Grass, Fire, and Water Pokemon.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Evolution Pokemon, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Kecleon
flavorText: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon has Unit Energy FightingDarknessFairy attached to it, it is a Fighting, Darkness, and Fairy Pokemon.

name: Pikipek
flavorText: This Pokemon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for attacks it fires off from its mouth.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokemon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Pikipek
flavorText: This Pokemon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for attacks it fires off from its mouth.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.

name: Trumbeak
flavorText: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is in your hand, you may reveal it. If you do, look at the top card of your opponent's deck and put this Pokemon in the Lost Zone. If that card is a Supporter card, you may put it in the Lost Zone. If your opponent has no cards in their deck, you can't use this Ability.

name: Toucannon
flavorText: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon evolved during this turn, this attack does nothing.

name: Shuckle-GX
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks from your opponent's Pokemon that have 2 or fewer Energy attached to them.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Sceptile-GX
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Move a Grass Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Virizion-GX
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Magcargo-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard the top card of your deck. If it's a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Discard any amount of basic Energy from this Pokemon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Blacephalon-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned and Confused.
Attack2Text: Put any amount of Fire Energy attached to your Pokemon in the Lost Zone. This attack does 50 damage for each card put in the Lost Zone in this way.

name: Suicune-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is on your Bench, you may shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Zeraora-GX
Ability1Text: Each of your Pokemon that has any Lightning Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: This Pokemon can't attack during your next turn.
Attack2Text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Sigilyph-GX
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX (even if this Pokemon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon equal to the damage done to this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: This attack does 60 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
